body: @cschneider how hard would it be to have a unit test with pax to ensure it is not broken in the main build?
A pax exam test is on my todo list. I think it is crucial to make sure the feature still works in the future.

Fwiw, validating the features with the Karaf 4 maven plugin ensure that the feature can be deployed correctly.  An integration test can certainly be done to actually test the bundles, but it's not necessary to verify that the bundles can be installed and resolved correctly.

Well I was more concerned about the runtime behavior than the installation (= ensure it deploys and then we can load properly classes, listeners etc... and that tccl is the right one).

Some work will get started soon with some lazy instantiation logic and I would like to avoid a half working state.
I would drop the author tags.

My bad. I had them as a template for my IDE and forgot about it.

I'll remove them in a future patch.
Thanks for your contribution, @krichter722!
Comment to link to [OPENJPA-2725](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENJPA-2725)
Fixed based on ilgrosso review
LGTM: @rmannibucau or @struberg do you see any issue for ASM upgrade?

yes, the ASM constant was not updated (see https://github.com/jgallimore/openjpa/blob/211cea18b34afe66a8c4d91d03db48a44d0be1d3/openjpa-kernel/src/main/java/org/apache/openjpa/enhance/AsmAdaptor.java#L119 for instance). Once done you can merge @ilgrosso

thanks @rmannibucau / please @jgallimore make the changes requested

Does it make sense to merge this PR to `2.4.x` as well? For instance, is ASM 6 compatible with Java 7?
Think so yes
Thanks, I'll update that. I have the change for 2.4.x too.

> I have the change for 2.4.x too

Cool :-)
Updated, and also submitted https://github.com/apache/openjpa/pull/12 for 2.4.x.

I merged this PR in e708e7c6bf4df81132d2ec187b14c773e6ecb41f - due to SVN / GIT bridge, it was not closed nor I have enough karma to do that.
Please close this PR manually.
@jgallimore thanks for your contribution anyway!
Thank you so much for merging. I'm excited to have made my first contribution to OpenJPA!

> I'm excited to have made my first contribution to OpenJPA!

and we're glad of your will to contribute ;-)

For future contributions, please consider sending an [ICLA](https://www.apache.org/licenses/#clas)
I should already have one on file - I'm an Apache TomEE committer.

> I should already have one on file - I'm an Apache TomEE committer.

Ah great :+1:
Hi @jgallimore please squash your commits
@jgallimore please close this PR, I don't have enough karma do do that, thanks.
This issue appears dated, but the merge has no conflicts. If it makes sense, it'd be great to get it into 2.4.3
Thanks for this PR @solomax : there are a bit too much formatting changes - which I'd agree with - and some changes I would rather remove from here and invite you to include in another PR.
Thanks @solomax this PR lgtm and I would merge it both to `trunk` and `2_4_X`: @struberg @rmannibucau any objection?

Thanks again @solomax !

Next targets could be:
* commons-collections -> commons-collections4
* commons-dbcp -> commons-dbcp2

WDYT? ;-)

Already working on `commons-collections -> commons-collections4`
Found one serious issue so far, please check https://markmail.org/message/l72ev2vezesgbfj2
Maybe you can suggest something ...
@solomax would you mind applying the same fixes to [MariaDBDictionary](https://github.com/apache/openjpa/blob/trunk/openjpa-jdbc/src/main/java/org/apache/openjpa/jdbc/sql/MariaDBDictionary.java)?

Sure,
will do later tonight
@ilgrosso MariaDb changes were added, previous PR had some files in wrong places (was done by `git apply svn.patch`), sorry for this

@solomax No troubles as we're on SVN, hence I could only grab the full diff for this PR and manually apply it to both `trunk` and `2.4.x` (with small modifications to restore Java 6 compatibility) branches.
Thanks!

At Apache OpenMeetings we have switched to GitBox
It is easier to review/comment and merge via PRs :)
We're also using GitBox at CXF, while at Syncope we're on the old Git / GitHub sync, still not finding enough reasons to move to the former, actually.

Thx @solomax - this PR looks good to me.

> I would like to remove ReferenceMap.HARD, SOFT, WEAK in favor of ReferenceStrength.HARD, SOFT, WEAK
> shall I add another commit to this PR, or create another one?

To me, you can add that here.

@struberg / @rmannibucau would you please doublecheck?

@rmannibucau I have this setting on by default in my IDE due to I had extremely bad experience of project migration without @Override being set.
Shall I remove all these annotations?
@solomax if possible it would be awesome to have this PR about commons-collection upgrade only and then if you want add override everywhere

sure, will do
will take some time :)
Hopefully this diff will be easier to read :)
Ok, I am going to merge this PR right now - but please don't forget to submit another for `@override`s ;-)

@ilgrosso this will break the build ... most probably
4.3-SNAPSHOT might not be online ...
@solomax let me check..
@solomax ah I see: do you know why `4.3-SNAPSHOT` is not [there](https://repository.apache.org/content/groups/snapshots/org/apache/commons/commons-collections4/) yet?

I'm afraid there no auto build :(
I've asked the devs: https://markmail.org/thread/tshcd4d54nxrvgbu

Will send additional email regarding SNAPSHOT

Something wrong :(
too much commits
Not sure why this PR has so much commits :(
This links to OPENJPA-2750

@solomax could you please rebase?
Anyway, I cannot see yet commons-collections4's 4.3-SNAPSHOT artifacts out there.. :-(

@ilgrosso could you please guide me with rebase?
I never used it :(

I wrote another email regarding `commons-collections4's 4.3-SNAPSHOT`
no answer yet :(

> could you please guide me with rebase?
> I never used it :(

I mean something like as https://robots.thoughtbot.com/keeping-a-github-fork-updated

Just have tried to rebase but no luck :(
rebase against `solomax/trunk` has no effect
rebase against `apache/trunk` conflicts and I have no idea how to resolve it :(

> rebase against apache/trunk conflicts and I have no idea how to resolve it :(

yep, you should rebasing against `apache/trunk` and solving the conflicts :-)
There have been no changes in `trunk` but yours, so I think you should be able to cope with those...

OK, the trick was to use `git rebase --skip` :)
But for some reason there are still 3 commits :(

> But for some reason there are still 3 commits :(

This could be fixed too, but it is not really a big issue since we are with SVN.
Great :)

ah, it seems you can merge this PR by yourself, when the commons-collection4 artifacts will be available ;-)
congrats!

Sure, will do :)
But I would like to perform contributions via PRs (at least for the first time)
Would it be OK?

> But I would like to perform contributions via PRs (at least for the first time)
> Would it be OK?

I don't see any issue with that.

Great, so will do the merge as soon as SNAPSHOT will be available
Thanks for the help!
Merged with 4709f38ba23244ad1c876ccf16704ccfdb099b73
LGTM, thanks @solomax!

@solomax I confirm I can see either [your commit](https://github.com/apache/openjpa/commit/9a5096308c29e278cd59253922110bdf3464951f) and the [PR merge](https://github.com/apache/openjpa/commit/b3edd42ee81194c419a395f0f6ea22d48be66105) on GitHub.

Moreover, I can see both as well at [ASF GIT](https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=openjpa.git;a=shortlog;h=refs/heads/master).

@solomax I confirm I can see either [your commit](https://github.com/apache/openjpa/commit/9a5096308c29e278cd59253922110bdf3464951f) and the [PR merge](https://github.com/apache/openjpa/commit/b3edd42ee81194c419a395f0f6ea22d48be66105) on GitHub.

Moreover, I can see both as well at [ASF GIT](https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=openjpa.git;a=shortlog;h=refs/heads/master).
This PR seems to be merged

@struberg, @rmannibucau I have removed `DBCPDriverDataSource` and `AutoDriverDataSource` classes
Is it OK to merge?

@solomax hmm, overall looks ok except jdbc.DriverDataSource which lost dbcp option (so can't be a 3.0.1). Shouldnt we put the BasicDataSource class of dbcp here even if we don't deliver it? Idea of dropping the wrappers was to support it by reflection so theorically we can keep it, no?

@rmannibucau I'm afraid I don't get it :(
`dbcp` should be one of the options for `jdbc.DriverDataSource`, 
but there should be no `DBCPDriverDataSource.java` and `AutoDriverDataSource.java`?
how it will work?
@solomax if you put o.a.commons.dbcp2...BasicDataSource it should work no?
@rmannibucau got it :) will try to update PR :)

Seems to be implemented
@rmannibucau could you please review latest commit?

Hmm, code still depends on dbcp which shouldnt be the case - was the goal of dropping datasource impl.

Overall it is ok to have dbcp as a string or setter mapping in a map of string/string (like "user" is mapped to "username" setter for this impl "xxxx") but the factory relies on the class so dbcp cant be optional still.

But yes, the "dbcp" config is what i had in mind

@rmannibucau I see the only way to remove dpcp dependency: to revert my 2 last commits
So there will be `DBCPDriverDataSource` class

@solomax works for me

side note for another PR - but dont want to forget it: why do we need this instead of creating a set of properties (a map string -> object) and allowing the user to configure it with our dsl "dbcp(username=user,password=connectionpassword)" etc
Could you please mark JIRA as resolved?
Bah.. fubar'd squash

PR was created too early by mistake
Tests are not created yet

We have moved to geronimo's JPA specs 2.2 in 44aede26df24d0e0615309c7b31fc59a1479231e, closing this PR.
Thanks anyway @jbonofre !

Thanks @michaelwiles for your contribution.
Would you please adjust `openjpa-persistence/src/main/java/org/apache/openjpa/persistence/criteria/Expressions.java` so that only effective modifications are submitted? I see large changes due to formatting, ATM.
hmmm... I'm going to create another pull request... this one is too broken to fix.
remade [here](https://github.com/apache/openjpa/pull/41)

AFAICT the `thunk` branch is not used any more, and kept only for historical reasons.

I see you also opened PR #45, against `master` branch: I think you should close this one.
@ilgrosso Ok, good to know! I wasnt really sure what trunk was for when I saw master, but I figured wth. Thanks!
@dazey3 you're welcome :+1:

@dazey3 shall it also be merged to other branches?

(edit)
Forgot there were separate PRs
sorry for the noise
@dazey3 I would merge almost the same changes - except for the root `pom.xml` where things should be already as proposed - onto `master` branch as well.
@dazey3 FYI I cherry-picked this commit to branch `2.4.x` as 711ad2145ac1efdf7ae0edcf2c86f7bc03313b56

I Opened an issue on JIRA.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/OPENJPA/issues/OPENJPA-169
@drungrin I guess you mean OPENJPA-2794, correct?
Yes, n OPENJPA-2794 is the one I created, sorry for the mistake.
Closing, as this is currently under discussion: https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/82739677363b480e0913496ccd33e449625052e821f4b0275f6101c6@%3Cdev.openjpa.apache.org%3E

Looks rational to me but requires more testing. Typical case I have in mind is duplicate parameter names. Equals impl was intended for container (lists/sets) and paramEquals to handle these cases.
So long story short if we get a complete coverage of ambiguous parameters I'm fine with this change.
@michaelwiles can you address @rmannibucau 's comment? Thanks!

I can flesh out the tests... add some more to validate various cases.

What would constitute an ambiguous parameter?
